Ge Ex Le Nu De Jos Jg Ru 1Sa 2Sa 1Ki 2Ki 1Ch 2Ch Ezr Ne Es Job Ps Pr Ec Son Isa Jer La Eze Da Ho Joe Am Ob Jon Mic Na Hab Zep Hag Zec Mal Mt Mr Lu Joh Ac Ro 1Co 2Co Ga Eph Php Col 1Th 2Th 1Ti 2Ti Tit Phm Heb Jas 1Pe 2Pe 1Jo 2Jo 3Jo Jud Re
Low Normal High

The Epistle of Paul to the

Ephesians

Summary"For by grace you have been saved through faith; and that not of yourselves, it is the gift of God; not as a result of works, so that no one may boast'' (2:8-9).

•    In chapters 4-5, Paul encourages the believer to “walk in a manner worthy of the calling”. Every believer has a responsibility to live as servants of Jesus Christ. In these chapters, Paul teaches that it takes hard work to be in unity with others, and that we are to be “imitators of God” (5:1). He mentions imperative truths and advice for well functioning families, including husbands and wives who upon the oath of marriage become as “one flesh” (5:31). Paul explains the concept of a biblical marriage. Marriage is a picture of Christ and the church (body of believers) and the way that Jesus Christ loved the church is the way that the husband must love his treasured wife, "Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ also loved the church and gave Himself up for her" (5:25). Paul doesn’t end there, he goes on to reinforce that husbands are to love their wives, "as their own bodies" and also to love their wives, "even as himself (vss 28;33).When a husband learns to love his wife in this way, his wife usually has no issues fulfilling her role and even enjoys it, "the wife must see to it that she respects her husband" (vs 33).

• In chapter 6, Paul instructs believers how to prepare for spiritual battle by dressing in the “full armor of God” (6:11). Prayer is the key weapon of the Christian soldier. He emphasizes his principle with the repeated statement “stand firm”.
    Outline
  2. 1. Paul’s Greeting to the Ephesians  ( 1:1⁠–⁠2 )
  3. 2. God’s Purpose for the Church  ( 1:3⁠–⁠3:21 )
  4. a. Spiritual Blessings  ( 1:3⁠–⁠14 )
  5. b. Spiritual Wisdom  ( 1:15⁠–⁠23 )
  6. c. Alive with Christ  ( 2:1⁠–⁠10 )
  7. d. One in Christ  ( 2:11⁠–⁠18 )
  8. e. Christ Our Cornerstone  ( 2:19⁠–⁠22 )
  9. f. The Mystery of the Gospel  ( 3:1⁠–⁠13 )
  10. g. Paul’s Prayer for the Ephesians  ( 3:14⁠–⁠21 )
  11. 3. Fulfilling God's Purpose for the Church  ( 4:1⁠–⁠6:20 )
  12. a. Unity in the Body  ( 4:1⁠–⁠16 )
  13. b. Righteous Living  ( 4:17⁠–⁠5:20 )
  14. i.   New Life in Christ  ( 4:17⁠–⁠32 )
  15. ii.  Imitators of God  ( 5:1⁠–⁠7 )
  16. iii. Children of Light  ( 5:8⁠–⁠20 )
  17. c. Authority and Submission  ( 5:21⁠–⁠6:9 )
  18. i.   Submit to One Another  ( 5:21 )
  19. ii.  Wives and Husbands  ( 5:22⁠–⁠33 )
  20. iii. Children and Parents  ( 6:1⁠–⁠4 )
  21. iv. Serving with Honor  ( 6:5⁠–⁠9 )
  22. d. The Full Armor of God  ( 6:10⁠–⁠20 )
  23. 4. Final Greetings  ( 6:21⁠–⁠24 )

1
Paul’s Greeting to the Ephesians

παυλος αποστολος ιησου χριστου δια θεληματος θεου τοις αγιοις τοις ουσιν εν εφεσω και πιστοις εν χριστω ιησου

StrongsGreekEnglishMorphology
G3972ΠαῦλοςPaulos   (N-NMS)
G3972 Παῦλος Paûlos pow-los of Latin origin; (little; but remotely from a derivative of παύω, meaning the same); Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle:--Paul, Paulus. 		ΠαῦλοςPaulos Paul, N-NMS

G1223 διά diá dee-ah a primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through (in very wide applications, local, causal, or occasional):--after, always, among, at, to avoid, because of (that), briefly, by, for (cause) … fore, from, in, by occasion of, of, by reason of, for sake, that, thereby, therefore, X though, through(-out), to, wherefore, with (-in). In composition it retains the same general importance. 		διὰdia by Prep

1 Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, to the saints which are at Ephesus, and to the faithful in Christ Jesus:Ephesians 1:1
Stats
Rank: #945 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 125 characters, 22 words, 97 letters, 35 vowels, 62 consonants
Translation
Greek: παυλος αποστολος ιησου χριστου δια θεληματος θεου τοις αγιοις τοις ουσιν εν εφεσω και πιστοις εν χριστω ιησου

Lit: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, To the saints being in Ephesus, and faithful in Christ Jesus.

KJV: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, to the saints which are at Ephesus, and to the faithful in Christ Jesus:
References

"an"
Ro 1:1: Paul: a servant of Jesus Christ: called to be an apostle: separated to the gospel of God:
1Co 1:1: Paul: called to be an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God: and Sosthenes our brother:
Ga 1:1: Paul: an apostle: (not of men: neither by man: but by Jesus Christ: and God the Father: who raised Him from the dead;)

"to the saints"
Ro 1:7: To all that be in Rome: beloved of God: called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father: and the Lord Jesus Christ.
1Co 1:2: To the church of God which is at Corinth: to them that are sanctified in Christ Jesus: called to be saints: with all that in every place call upon the name of Jesus Christ our Lord: both theirs and ours:
2Co 1:1: Paul: an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God: and Timothy our brother: to the church of God which is at Corinth: with all the saints which are in all Achaia:

"which"
Eph 6:21: But that you also may know my affairs: and how I do: Tychicus: a beloved brother and faithful minister in the Lord: will make known to you all things:
Nu 12:7: My servant Moses is not so: who is faithful in all my house.
Lu 16:10: He who is faithful in that which is least is faithful also in much: and he who is unjust in the least is unjust also in much.
Ac 16:15: When she was baptized: and her household: she besought us: saying: If you have judged me to be faithful to the Lord: come into my house: and abide there. And she constrained us.
1Co 4:12: 17: Labour: working with our own hands: being reviled: we bless; being persecuted: we suffer it:
Ga 3:9: So then they which be of faith are blessed with faithful Abraham.
Col 1:2: To the saints and faithful brothers in Christ which are at Colosse: Grace be to you: and peace: from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Re 2:10: 13: Fear none of those things which you will suffer: look: the devil will cast some of you into prison: that you may be tried; and you will have tribulation 10 days: be you faithful to death: and I will give you a crown of life.
Re 17:14: These will make war with the Lamb: and the Lamb will overcome them: for He is Lord of lords: and King of kings: and they that are with Him are called: and chosen: and faithful.

"faithful"
Ac 19:1-20: It came to pass: that: while Apollos was at Corinth: Paul having passed through the upper coasts came to Ephesus: and finding certain disciples:

χαρις υμιν και ειρηνη απο θεου πατρος ημων και κυριου ιησου χριστου

2 Grace be to you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.Ephesians 1:2
Stats
Counts: 82 characters, 11 words, 61 letters, 23 vowels, 38 consonants
Translation
Greek: χαρις υμιν και ειρηνη απο θεου πατρος ημων και κυριου ιησου χριστου

Lit: Grace to you and peace from God the Father of us and the Lord Jesus Christ.

KJV: Grace be to you, and peace, from God our Father, and [from] the Lord Jesus Christ.
References

"Grace be to you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ."
Ro 1:7: To all that be in Rome: beloved of God: called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father: and the Lord Jesus Christ.
2Co 1:2: Grace be to you and peace from God our Father: and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Ga 1:3: Grace be to you and peace from God the Father: and from our Lord Jesus Christ:
Tit 1:4: To Titus: my own son after the common faith: Grace: mercy: and peace: from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.

God’s Purpose for the Church

ευλογητος ο θεος και πατηρ του κυριου ημων ιησου χριστου ο ευλογησας ημας εν παση ευλογια πνευματικη εν τοις επουρανιοις {VAR2: εν } χριστω

3 Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ:Ephesians 1:3
Stats
Rank: #141 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 136 characters, 21 words, 109 letters, 36 vowels, 73 consonants
Translation
Greek: ευλογητος ο θεος και πατηρ του κυριου ημων ιησου χριστου ο ευλογησας ημας εν παση ευλογια πνευματικη εν τοις επουρανιοις {VAR2: εν } χριστω

Lit: Blessed be the God and Father of the Lord of us Jesus Christ, the One having blessed us with every blessing spiritual in the heavenly realms in Christ,

KJV: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly [places] in Christ:
References

"Blessed"
Ge 14:20: Blessed be the most high God: which has delivered your enemies into your hand. And He gave Him tithes of all.
1Ch 29:20: David said to all the congregation: Now bless the LORD your God. And all the congregation blessed the LORD God of their fathers: and bowed down their heads: and worshipped the LORD: and the king.
Ne 9:5: Then the Levites: Jeshua: and Kadmiel: Bani: Hashabniah: Sherebiah: Hodijah: Shebaniah: and Pethahiah: said: Stand up and bless the LORD your God for ever and ever: and blessed be your glorious name: which is exalted above all blessing and praise.
Ps 72:19: Blessed be his glorious name for ever: and let the whole earth be filled with his glory; Amen: and Amen.
Da 4:34: At the end of the days I Nebuchadnezzar lifted up my eyes to heaven: and my understanding returned to me: and I blessed the most High: and I praised and honoured him that lives for ever: whose dominion is an everlasting dominion: and his kingdom is from generation to generation:
Lu 2:28: Then took He Him up in His arms: and blessed God: and said:
2Co 1:3: Blessed be God: even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ: the Father of mercies: and the God of all comfort;
1Pe 1:3: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ: which according to His abundant mercy has begotten us again to a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead:
Re 4:9-11: When those beasts give glory and honour and thanks to him that sat on the throne: who lives for ever and ever:
Re 5:9-14: They sung a new song: saying: You are worthy to take the book: and to open the seals thereof: for you were killed: and have redeemed us to God by your blood out of every kindred: and tongue: and people: and nation;

"God"
Eph 1:17: That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ: the Father of glory: may give to you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him:
Joh 10:29: 30: My Father: which gave them me: is greater than all; and no man is able to pluck them out of my Father's hand.
Joh 20:17: Jesus says to her: Touch not me; for I not am yet ascended to my Father: but go to my brothers: and say to them: I ascend to my Father: and your Father; and to my God: and your God.
Ro 15:6: That you may with one mind and one mouth glorify God: even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
2Co 1:3: Blessed be God: even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ: the Father of mercies: and the God of all comfort;
2Co 11:31: The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ: which is blessed for evermore: knows that I not lie.
Php 2:11: that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord: to the glory of God the Father.

"who"
Ge 12:2: 3: I will make of you a great nation: and I will bless you: and make your name great; and you will be a blessing:
Ge 22:18: In your seed will all the nations of the earth be blessed; because you have obeyed my voice.
1Ch 4:10: Jabez called on the God of Israel: saying: Oh that you would'>would bless me indeed: and enlarge my coast: and that your hand might be with me: and that you would'>would keep me from evil: that it not may grieve me! And God granted Him that which He requested.
Ps 72:17: His name will endure for ever: his name will be continued as long as the sun: and men will be blessed in him: all nations will call him blessed.
Ps 134:3: The LORD that made heaven and earth bless you out of Zion.
Isa 61:9: Their seed will be known among the Gentiles: and their offspring among the people: all that see them will acknowledge them: that they are the seed which the LORD has blessed.
Ga 3:9: So then they which be of faith are blessed with faithful Abraham.

"heavenly"
Eph 1:20: Which He wrought in Christ: when He raised Him from the dead: and set Him at His own right hand in the heavenly places:
Eph 2:6: has raised us up together: and made us sit together in heavenly places in Christ Jesus:
Eph 3:10: To the intent that now to the principalities and powers in heavenly places might be known by the church the manifold wisdom of God:
Eph 6:12: For we not wrestle against flesh and blood: but against principalities: against powers: against the rulers of the darkness of this world: against spiritual wickedness in high places.
Heb 8:5: Who serve to the example and shadow of heavenly things: as Moses was admonished of God when He was about to make the tabernacle: for: See: says He: that you make all things according to the pattern showed to you in the mount.
Heb 9:23: It was therefore necessary that the patterns of things in the heavens should be purified with these; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.

"places, or, things"
Eph 6:12: For we not wrestle against flesh and blood: but against principalities: against powers: against the rulers of the darkness of this world: against spiritual wickedness in high places.

"in Christ"
Eph 1:10: That in the dispensation of the fulness of times He might gather together in one all things in Christ: both which are in heaven: and which are on earth; even in Him:
Joh 14:20: At that day you will know that I am in my Father: and you in me: and I in you.
Joh 15:2-5: Every branch in me that bears'>bears not fruit he takes away: and every branch that bears'>bears fruit: he purges it: that it may bring forth more fruit.
Joh 17:21: That they all may be one; as you: Father: are in me: and I in you: that they also may be one in us: that the world may believe that you have sent me.
Ro 12:5: So we: being many: are one body in Christ: and every one members one of another.
1Co 1:30: But of Him are you in Christ Jesus: who of God is made to us wisdom: and righteousness: and sanctification: and redemption:
1Co 12:12: For as the body is one: and has many members: and all the members of that one body: being many: are one body: so also is Christ.
2Co 5:17: 21: Therefore if any man be in Christ: He is a new creature: old things are passed away; look: all things are become new.

4 According as he has chosen us in him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and without blame before him in love:Ephesians 1:4
Stats
Rank: #298 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 134 characters, 25 words, 107 letters, 42 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Greek: καθως εξελεξατο ημας εν αυτω προ καταβολης κοσμου ειναι ημας αγιους και αμωμους κατενωπιον αυτου εν αγαπη

Lit: just as He chose us in Him before the foundation of the world, to be for us holy and blameless before Him, in love

KJV: According as he hath chosen us in him before the foundation of the world, that we should be holy and without blame before him in love:
References

"as"
De 7:6: 7: For you are an holy people to the LORD your God: the LORD your God has chosen you to be a special people to Himself: above all people that are upon the face of the earth.
Ps 135:4: For the LORD has chosen Jacob to Himself: and Israel for His peculiar treasure.
Isa 41:8: 9: But you: Israel: are my servant: Jacob whom I have chosen: the seed of Abraham my friend.
Isa 42:1: Look my servant: whom I uphold; my elect: in whom my soul delights; I have put my spirit upon him: he will bring forth judgment to the Gentiles.
Isa 65:8-10: Thus says the LORD: As the new wine is found in the cluster: and one says: Destroy not it; for a blessing is in it: so will I do for my servants' sakes: that I not may destroy them all.
Mt 11:25: 26: At that time Jesus answered and said: I thank you: O Father: Lord of heaven and earth: because you have hid these things from the wise and prudent: and have revealed them to babes.
Mt 24:22: 24: Except those days should be shortened: there should no flesh be saved: but for the elect's sake those days will be shortened.
Mt 24:31: He will send his angels with a great sound of a trumpet: and they will gather together his elect from the 4 winds: from one end of heaven to the other.
Joh 10:16: Other sheep I have: which not are of this fold: them also I must bring: and they will hear my voice; and there will be one fold: and one shepherd.
Ac 13:48: When the Gentiles heard this: they were glad: and glorified the word of the Lord: and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed.
Ac 18:10: For I am with you: and no man will set on you to hurt you: for I have much people in this city.
Ro 8:28: 30: 33: We know that all things work together for good to them that love God: to them who are the called according to His purpose.
Ro 9:23: 24: That he might make known the riches of his glory on the vessels of mercy: which he had afore prepared to glory:
Ro 11:5: 6: Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace.
2Th 2:13: 14: But we are bound to give thanks alway to God for you: brothers beloved of the Lord: because God has from the beginning chosen you to salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth:
2Ti 2:10: Therefore I endure all things for the elect's sakes: that they may also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.
Tit 1:1: 2: Paul: a servant of God: and an apostle of Jesus Christ: according to the faith of God's elect: and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;
Jas 2:5: Listen: my beloved brothers: Has not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith: and heirs of the kingdom which He has promised to them that love Him?
1Pe 1:2: Elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father: through sanctification of the Spirit: to obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace to you: and peace: be multiplied.
1Pe 2:9: But you are a chosen generation: a royal priesthood: an holy nation: a peculiar people; that you should show forth the praises of him who has called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:

"before"
Mt 25:34: Then will the King say to them on His right hand: Come: you blessed of my Father: inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world:
Joh 17:24: Father: I will that they also: whom you have given me: be with me where I am; that they may look my glory: which you have given me: for you lovedst me before the foundation of the world.
Ac 15:18: Known to God are all His works from the beginning of the world.
1Pe 1:20: Who truly was foreordained before the foundation of the world: but was manifest in these last times for you:
Re 13:8: All that dwell upon the earth will worship him: whose names not are written in the book of life of the Lamb killed from the foundation of the world.
Re 17:8: The beast that you saw was: and not is; and will ascend out of the bottomless pit: and go into perdition: and they that dwell on the earth will wonder: whose names not were written in the book of life from the foundation of the world: when they look the beast that was: and not is: and yet is.

"that"
Eph 2:10: For we are His workmanship: created in Christ Jesus to good works: which God has before ordained that we should walk in them.
Lu 1:74: 75: That he would grant to us: that we being delivered out of the hand of our enemies might serve him without fear:
Joh 15:16: You not have chosen me: but I have chosen you: and ordained you: that you should go and bring forth fruit: and that your fruit should remain: that whatever you will ask of the Father in my name: He may give it you.
Ro 8:28: 29: We know that all things work together for good to them that love God: to them who are the called according to His purpose.
Col 3:12: Put on therefore: as the elect of God: holy and beloved: bowels of mercies: kindness: humbleness of mind: meekness: longsuffering;
1Th 4:7: For God has not called us to uncleanness: but to holiness.
2Ti 1:9: Who has saved us: and called us with an holy calling: not according to our works: but according to His own purpose and grace: which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began:
2Ti 2:19: Nevertheless the foundation of God stands sure: having this seal: The Lord knows them that are His. And: Let every one that names the name of Christ depart from iniquity.
Tit 2:11: 12: For the grace of God that brings salvation has appeared to all men:
2Pe 1:5-10: Beside this: giving all diligence: add to your faith virtue; and to virtue knowledge;

"without"
Eph 5:27: That he might present it to himself a glorious church: not having spot: or wrinkle: or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.
1Co 1:8: Who will also confirm you to the end: that you may be blameless in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ.
Php 2:15: That you may be blameless and harmless: the sons of God: without rebuke: in the middle of a crooked and perverse nation: among whom you shine as lights in the world;
Col 1:22: In the body of his flesh through death: to present you holy and unblameable and unreproveable in his sight:
2Pe 3:14: For what reason: beloved: seeing that you look for such things: be diligent that you may be found of him in peace: without spot: and blameless.

"love"
Eph 3:17: That Christ may dwell in your hearts by faith; that you: being rooted and grounded in love:
Eph 4:2: 15: 16: With all lowliness and meekness: with longsuffering: forbearing one another in love;
Eph 5:2: Walk in love: as Christ also has loved us: and has given Himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour.
Ga 5:6: 13: 22: For in Jesus Christ neither circumcision availeth any thing: nor uncircumcision; but faith which works by love.
Col 2:2: That their hearts might be comforted: being knit together in love: and to all riches of the full assurance of understanding: to the acknowledgement of the mystery of God: and of the Father: and of Christ;
1Th 3:12: The Lord make you to increase and abound in love one toward another: and toward all men: even as we do toward you:
1Jo 4:16: We have known and believed the love that God has to us. God is love; and He that'>He who dwells'>dwells in love dwells'>dwells in God: and God in Him.

 προορισας ημας εις υιοθεσιαν δια ιησου χριστου εις αυτον κατα την ευδοκιαν του θεληματος αυτου

G1519 εἰς eis ice a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. G1223 διά diá dee-ah a primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through (in very wide applications, local, causal, or occasional):--after, always, among, at, to avoid, because of (that), briefly, by, for (cause) … fore, from, in, by occasion of, of, by reason of, for sake, that, thereby, therefore, X though, through(-out), to, wherefore, with (-in). 5 Having predestinated us to the adoption of children by Jesus Christ to Himself, according to the good pleasure of His will,Ephesians 1:5
Stats
Rank: #1596 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 125 characters, 20 words, 103 letters, 38 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Greek: προορισας ημας εις υιοθεσιαν δια ιησου χριστου εις αυτον κατα την ευδοκιαν του θεληματος αυτου

Lit: having predestined us for divine adoption as sons through Jesus Christ, to Himself, according to the good pleasure of the will of Him,

KJV: Having predestinated us unto the adoption of children by Jesus Christ to himself, according to the good pleasure of his will,
References

"predestinated"

Ro 8:29: 30: For whom He did foreknow: He also did predestinate to be conformed to the image of His Son: that He might be the firstborn among many brothers.

"unto"

Heb 2:10-15: For it became him: for whom are all things: and by whom are all things: in bringing many sons to glory: to make the captain of their salvation perfect through sufferings.

StrongsGreekEnglishMorphology
G1519εἰςeis   (Prep)
G1519 εἰς eis ice a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. Often used in composition with the same general import, but only with verbs (etc.) expressing motion (literally or figuratively). 		εἰςeis to Prep

G5485χάριτοςcharitos   (N-GFS)
G5485 χάρις cháris khar-ece from χαίρω; graciousness (as gratifying), of manner or act (abstract or concrete; literal, figurative or spiritual; especially the divine influence upon the heart, and its reflection in the life; including gratitude):--acceptable, benefit, favour, gift, grace(- ious), joy, liberality, pleasure, thank(-s, -worthy). 		χάριτοςcharitos of grace N-GFS
G846αὐτοῦautou   (PPro-GM3S)
G846 αὐτός autós ow-tos from the particle (perhaps akin to the base of ἀήρ through the idea of a baffling wind) (backward); the reflexive pronoun self, used (alone or in the comparative ἑαυτοῦ) of the third person , and (with the proper personal pronoun) of the other persons:--her, it(-self), one, the other, (mine) own, said, (self-), the) same, ((him-, my-, thy- )self, (your-)selves, she, that, their(-s), them(-selves), there(-at, - by, -in, -into, -of, -on, -with), they, (these) things, this (man), those, together, very, which. Compare αὑτοῦ., 		αὐτοῦautou of Him, PPro-GM3S

6 To the praise of the glory of his grace, wherein he has made us accepted in the beloved.Ephesians 1:6
Stats
Rank: #2270 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 89 characters, 17 words, 70 letters, 28 vowels, 42 consonants
Translation
Greek: εις επαινον δοξης της χαριτος αυτου εν η εχαριτωσεν ημας εν τω ηγαπημενω

Lit: to the praise of the glory of the of grace of Him, which He has freely given us in the Beloved One,

KJV: To the praise of the glory of his grace, wherein he hath made us accepted in the beloved.
References

"praise"
Eph 1:7: 8: 12: 14: 18: In whom we have redemption through his blood: the forgiveness of sins: according to the riches of his grace;
Eph 2:7: That in the ages to come He might show the exceeding riches of His grace in His kindness toward us through Christ Jesus.
Eph 3:10: 11: To the intent that now to the principalities and powers in heavenly places might be known by the church the manifold wisdom of God:
Pr 16:4: The LORD has made all things for Himself: yes: even the wicked for the day of evil.
Isa 43:21: This people have I formed for myself; they will show forth my praise.
Isa 61:3: 11: To appoint to them that mourn in Zion: to give to them beauty for ashes: the oil of joy for mourning: the garment of praise for the spirit of heaviness; that they might be called trees of righteousness: the planting of the LORD: that He might be glorified.
Jer 33:9: It will be to me a name of joy: a praise and an honour before all the nations of the earth: which will hear all the good that I do to them: and they will fear and tremble for all the goodness and for all the prosperity that I procure to it.
Lu 2:14: Glory to God in the high: and on earth peace: good will toward men.
Ro 9:23: 24: That he might make known the riches of his glory on the vessels of mercy: which he had afore prepared to glory:
2Co 4:15: For all things are for your sakes: that the abundant grace might through the thanksgiving of many redound to the glory of God.
Php 1:11: Being filled with the fruits of righteousness: which are by Jesus Christ: to the glory and praise of God.
Php 4:19: But my God will supply all your need according to His riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
2Th 1:8-10: In flaming fire taking vengeance on them that not know God: and that not obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ:
1Ti 1:14-16: The grace of our Lord was exceeding abundant with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.
1Pe 2:9: But you are a chosen generation: a royal priesthood: an holy nation: a peculiar people; that you should show forth the praises of him who has called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:
1Pe 4:11: If any man speak: let Him speak as the oracles of God; if any man minister: let Him do it as of the ability which God gives: that God in all things may be glorified through Jesus Christ: to whom be praise and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.

"he"
Isa 45:24: 25: Surely: will one say: in the LORD have I righteousness and strength: even to Him will men come; and all that are incensed against Him will be ashamed.
Jer 23:6: In His days Judah will be saved: and Israel will dwell safely: and this is His name whereby He will be called: THE LORD OUR RIGHTEOUSNESS.
Ro 3:22-26: Even the righteousness of God which is by faith of Jesus Christ to all and upon all them that believe: for there is no difference:
Ro 5:15-19: not But as the offence: so also is the free gift. For if through the offence of one many be dead: much more the grace of God: and the gift by grace: which is by one man: Jesus Christ: has abounded to many.
Ro 8:1: There is therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus: who not walk after the flesh: but after the Spirit.
2Co 5:21: For He has made Him to be sin for us: who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in Him.
Php 3:9: Be found in Him: not having my own righteousness: which is of the law: but that which is through the faith of Christ: the righteousness which is of God by faith:
1Pe 2:5: You also: as lively stones: are built up a spiritual house: an holy priesthood: to offer up spiritual sacrifices: acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.

"in"
Ps 22:20: Deliver my soul from the sword; my darling from the power of the dog.
Ps 60:5: That your beloved may be delivered; save with your right hand: and hear me.
Pr 8:30: 31: Then I was by him: as one brought up with him: and I was daily his delight: rejoicing always before him;

Isa 49:1-3: Listen: O isles: to me; and listen: you people: from far; The LORD has called me from the womb; from the bowels of my mother has He made mention of my name.
Zec 13:7: Awake: O sword: against my shepherd: and against the man that is my fellow: says the LORD of hosts: smite the shepherd: and the sheep will be scattered: and I will turn my hand upon the little ones.
Mt 3:17: indeed a voice from heaven: saying: This is my beloved Son: in whom I am well pleased.
Mt 17:5: While He yet spoke: look: a bright cloud overshadowed them: and look a voice out of the cloud: which said: This is my beloved Son: in whom I am well pleased; hear you Him.
Joh 3:35: The Father loves the Son: and has given all things into His hand.
Joh 10:17: Therefore does my Father love me: because I lay down my life: that I might take it again.

G1223διὰdia   (Prep)
G1223 διά diá dee-ah a primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through (in very wide applications, local, causal, or occasional):--after, always, among, at, to avoid, because of (that), briefly, by, for (cause) … fore, from, in, by occasion of, of, by reason of, for sake, that, thereby, therefore, X though, through(-out), to, wherefore, with (-in). 7 In whom we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of his grace;Ephesians 1:7
Stats
Rank: #197 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 108 characters, 17 words, 87 letters, 32 vowels, 55 consonants
Translation
Greek: εν ω εχομεν την απολυτρωσιν δια του αιματος αυτου την αφεσιν των παραπτωματων κατα τον πλουτον της χαριτος αυτου

Lit: in whom we have redemption through the blood of Him, the forgiveness of trespasses, according to the riches of the grace of Him,

KJV: In whom we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of sins, according to the riches of his grace;
References

"whom"
Job 33:24: Then he is gracious to him: and says: Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.
Ps 130:7: Let Israel hope in the LORD: for with the LORD there is mercy: and with Him is plenteous redemption.
Da 9:24-26: 70 weeks are determined upon your people and upon your holy city: to finish the transgression: and to make an end of sins: and to make reconciliation for iniquity: and to bring in everlasting righteousness: and to seal up the vision and prophecy: and to anoint the most Holy.
Zec 9:11: As for you also: by the blood of your covenant I have sent forth your prisoners out of the pit wherein is no water.
Zec 13:1: 7: In that day there will be a fountain opened to the house of David and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem for sin and for uncleanness.
Mt 20:28: Even as the Son of man not came to be ministered to: but to minister: and to give His life a ransom for many.
Mt 26:28: For this is my blood of the new testament: which is shed for many for the remission of sins.
Mr 14:24: He said to them: This is my blood of the new testament: which is shed for many.
Ac 20:28: Take heed therefore to yourselves: and to all the flock: over the which the Holy Ghost has made you overseers: to feed the church of God: which He has purchased with His own blood.
Ro 3:24: Being justified freely by His grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:
1Co 1:30: But of Him are you in Christ Jesus: who of God is made to us wisdom: and righteousness: and sanctification: and redemption:
Col 1:14: In whom we have redemption through his blood: even the forgiveness of sins:
1Ti 2:6: Who gave himself a ransom for all: to be testified in due time.
Tit 2:14: Who gave himself for us: that he might redeem us from all iniquity: and purify to himself a peculiar people: zealous of good works.
Heb 9:12-15: 22: Neither by the blood of goats and calves: but by his own blood he entered in once into the holy place: having obtained eternal redemption for us.
Heb 10:4-12: For it is not possible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins.
1Pe 1:18: 19: Forasmuch as you know that you not were redeemed with corruptible things: as silver and gold: from your vain conversation received by tradition from your fathers;
1Pe 2:24: Who his own self bare our sins in his own body on the tree: that we: being dead to sins: should live to righteousness: by whose stripes you were healed.
1Pe 3:18: For Christ also has once suffered for sins: the just for the unjust: that He might bring us to God: being put to death in the flesh: but quickened by the Spirit:
1Jo 2:2: He is the propitiation for our sins: not and for ours only: but also for the sins of the whole world.
1Jo 4:10: Herein is love: not that we loved God: but that He loved us: and sent His Son to be the propitiation for our sins.
Re 5:9: They sung a new song: saying: You are worthy to take the book: and to open the seals thereof: for you were killed: and have redeemed us to God by your blood out of every kindred: and tongue: and people: and nation;
Re 14:4: These are they which not were defiled with women; for they are virgins. These are they which follow the Lamb wherever He goes. These were redeemed from among men: being the firstfruits to God and to the Lamb.

"the forgiveness"
Ex 34:7: Keeping mercy for thousands: forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin: and that will by no means clear the guilty; visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children: and upon the children's children: to the third and to the fourth generation.
Ps 32:1: 2: A Psalm of David: Maschil.>> Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven: whose sin is covered.
Ps 86:5: For you: Lord: are good: and ready to forgive; and plenteous in mercy to all them that call upon you.
Ps 130:4: But there is forgiveness with you: that you may be feared.
Isa 43:25: I: even I: am he who blots out your transgressions for my own sake: and not will remember your sins.
Isa 55:6: 7: Seek you the LORD while He may be found: call you upon Him while He is near:
Jer 31:34: They will teach no more every man His neighbour: and every man His brother: saying: Know the LORD: for they will all know me: from the least of them to the great of them: says the LORD: for I will forgive their iniquity: and I will remember their sin no more.
Da 9:9: 19: To the Lord our God belong mercies and forgivenesses: though we have rebelled against Him;
Jon 4:2: He prayed to the LORD: and said: I pray you: O LORD: was not this my saying: when I was yet in my country? Therefore I fled before to Tarshish: for I knew that you are a gracious God: and merciful: slow to anger: and of great kindness: and repent you of the evil.
Mic 7:18: Who is a God like to you: that pardons iniquity: and passs by the transgression of the remnant of His heritage? He retains not His anger for ever: because He delights in mercy.
Lu 1:77: To give knowledge of salvation to his people by the remission of their sins:
Lu 7:40-42: 47-50: Jesus answering said to Him: Simon: I have somewhat to say to you. And He says: Master: say on.
Lu 24:47: That repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations: beginning at Jerusalem.
Joh 20:23: Whose soever sins you remit: they are remitted to them; and whose soever sins you retain: they are retained.
Ac 2:38: Then Peter said to them: Repent: and be baptized every one of you in the name of Jesus Christ for the remission of sins: and you will receive the gift of the Holy Ghost.
Ac 3:19: Repent you therefore: and be converted: that your sins may be blotted out: when the times of refreshing will come from the presence of the Lord;
Ac 10:43: To him give all the prophets witness: that through his name whoever believes in him will receive remission of sins.
Ac 13:38: 39: Be it known to you therefore: men and brothers: that through this man is preached to you the forgiveness of sins:
Ro 4:6-9: Even as David also describes the blessedness of the man: to whom God imputes righteousness without works:
Col 2:13: you: being dead in your sins and the uncircumcision of your flesh: has he quickened together with him: having forgiven you all trespasses;
Heb 10:17: 18: Their sins and iniquities will I remember no more.
1Jo 1:7-9: But if we walk in the light: as He is in the light: we have fellowship one with another: and the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanses us from all sin.
1Jo 2:12: I write to you: little children: because your sins are forgiven you for his name's sake.

"to"
Eph 1:6: To the praise of the glory of his grace: wherein he has made us accepted in the beloved.
Eph 2:4: 7: But God: who is rich in mercy: for His great love wherewith He loved us:
Eph 3:8: 16: To me: who am less than the least of all saints: is this grace given: that I should preach among the Gentiles the unsearchable riches of Christ;
Ro 2:4: Or despise you the riches of His goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leads you to repentance?
Ro 3:24: Being justified freely by His grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:
Ro 9:23: That he might make known the riches of his glory on the vessels of mercy: which he had afore prepared to glory:
2Co 8:9: For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ: that: though He was rich: yet for your sakes He became poor: that you through His poverty might be rich.
Php 4:19: But my God will supply all your need according to His riches in glory by Christ Jesus.
Col 1:27: To whom God would make known what is the riches of the glory of this mystery among the Gentiles; which is Christ in you: the hope of glory:
Col 2:2: That their hearts might be comforted: being knit together in love: and to all riches of the full assurance of understanding: to the acknowledgement of the mystery of God: and of the Father: and of Christ;
Tit 3:6: Which He shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;

G1519εἰςeis   (Prep)
G1519 εἰς eis ice a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. Often used in composition with the same general import, but only with verbs (etc.) expressing motion (literally or figuratively). 		εἰςeis upon Prep

8 Wherein he has abounded toward us in all wisdom and prudence;Ephesians 1:8
Stats
Rank: #602 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 62 characters, 11 words, 51 letters, 20 vowels, 31 consonants
Translation
Greek: ης επερισσευσεν εις ημας εν παση σοφια και φρονησει

Lit: which He lavished upon us in all wisdom and understanding,

KJV: Wherein he hath abounded toward us in all wisdom and prudence;
References

"he"
Ro 5:15: 20: 21: not But as the offence: so also is the free gift. For if through the offence of one many be dead: much more the grace of God: and the gift by grace: which is by one man: Jesus Christ: has abounded to many.

"in"
Eph 1:11: In whom also we have obtained an inheritance: being predestinated according to the purpose of him who works all things after the counsel of his own will:
Eph 3:10: To the intent that now to the principalities and powers in heavenly places might be known by the church the manifold wisdom of God:
Ps 104:24: O LORD: how manifold are your works! in wisdom have you made them all: the earth is full of your riches.
Pr 8:12: I wisdom dwell with prudence: and find out knowledge of witty inventions.
Isa 52:13: Look: my servant will deal prudently: he will be exalted and extolled: and be very high.
Da 2:20: 21: Daniel answered and said: Blessed be the name of God for ever and ever: for wisdom and might are His:
Mt 11:19: The Son of man came eating and drinking: and they say: Look a man gluttonous: and a winebibber: a friend of publicans and sinners. But wisdom is justified of her children.
Ro 11:33: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchable are His judgments: and His ways past finding out!
1Co 1:19-24: For it is written: I will destroy the wisdom of the wise: and will bring not tohing the understanding of the prudent.
1Co 2:7: But we speak the wisdom of God in a mystery: even the hidden wisdom: which God ordained before the world to our glory:
Col 2:3: In whom are hid all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.
Jude 1:25: To the only wise God our Saviour: be glory and majesty: dominion and power: both now and ever. Amen.
Re 5:12: Saying with a loud voice: Worthy is the Lamb that was killed to receive power: and riches: and wisdom: and strength: and honour: and glory: and blessing.

G2596 κατά katá kat-ah a primary particle; (prepositionally) down (in place or time), in varied relations (according to the case (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined):--about, according as (to), after, against, (when they were) X alone, among, and, X apart, (even, like) as (concerning, pertaining to touching), X aside, at, before, beyond, by, to the charge of, (charita-)bly, concerning, + covered, (dai-)ly, down, every, (+ far more) exceeding, X more excellent, for, from … to, godly, in(-asmuch, divers, every, -to, respect of), … by, after the manner of, + by any means, beyond (out of) measure, X mightily, more, X natural, of (up-)on (X part), out (of every), over against, (+ your) X own, + particularly, so, through(-oughout, -oughout every), thus, (un-)to(-gether, -ward), X uttermost, where(-by), with. 9 Having made known to us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure which he has purposed in himself:Ephesians 1:9
Stats
Rank: #2880 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 116 characters, 20 words, 94 letters, 33 vowels, 61 consonants
Translation
Greek: γνωρισας ημιν το μυστηριον του θεληματος αυτου κατα την ευδοκιαν αυτου ην προεθετο εν αυτω

Lit: having made known to us the mystery of the will of Him according to the pleasure of Him, which He purposed in Him

KJV: Having made known unto us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure which he hath purposed in himself:
References

"made"
Eph 1:17: 18: That the God of our Lord Jesus Christ: the Father of glory: may give to you the spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of Him:
Eph 3:3-9: How that by revelation he made known to me the mystery; (as I wrote afore in few words:
Mt 13:11: He answered and said to them: Because it is given to you to know the mysteries of the kingdom of heaven: but to them it not is given.
Ro 16:25-27: Now to Him that is of power to stablish you according to my gospel: and the preaching of Jesus Christ: according to the revelation of the mystery: which was kept secret since the world began:
1Co 2:10-12: But God has revealed them to us by His Spirit: for the Spirit searches all things: yes: the deep things of God.
Ga 1:12: 16: For I neither received it of man: neither was I taught it: but by the revelation of Jesus Christ.
Col 1:26-28: Even the mystery which has been hid from ages and from generations: but now is made manifest to his saints:
1Ti 3:16: Without controversy great is the mystery of godliness: God was manifest in the flesh: justified in the Spirit: seen of angels: preached to the Gentiles: believed on in the world: received up into glory.

"purposed"
Eph 1:11: In whom also we have obtained an inheritance: being predestinated according to the purpose of him who works all things after the counsel of his own will:
Eph 3:11: According to the eternal purpose which He purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord:
Job 23:13: 14: But he is in one mind: and who can turn him? and what his soul desires: even that he does.
Ps 33:11: The counsel of the LORD stands for ever: the thoughts of His heart to all generations.
Isa 14:24-27: The LORD of hosts has sworn: saying: Surely as I have thought: so will it come to pass; and as I have purposed: so will it stand:
Isa 46:10: 11: Declaring the end from the beginning: and from ancient times the things that not are yet done: saying: My counsel will stand: and I will do all my pleasure:
Jer 2:29: For what reason will you plead with me? you all have transgressed against me: says the LORD.
La 3:37: 38: Who is He that says: and it comes to pass: when the Lord commands it not?
Ac 2:23: Him: being delivered by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God: you have taken: and by wicked hands have crucified and killed:
Ac 4:28: For to do whatever your hand and your counsel determined before to be done.
Ac 13:48: When the Gentiles heard this: they were glad: and glorified the word of the Lord: and as many as were ordained to eternal life believed.
Ro 8:28: We know that all things work together for good to them that love God: to them who are the called according to His purpose.
2Ti 1:9: Who has saved us: and called us with an holy calling: not according to our works: but according to His own purpose and grace: which was given us in Christ Jesus before the world began:

10 That in the dispensation of the fulness of times He might gather together in one all things in Christ, both which are in heaven, and which are on earth; even in Him:Ephesians 1:10
Stats
Rank: #2641 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 165 characters, 29 words, 130 letters, 48 vowels, 82 consonants
Translation
Greek: εις οικονομιαν του πληρωματος των καιρων ανακεφαλαιωσασθαι τα παντα εν τω χριστω τα τε εν τοις ουρανοις και τα επι της γης

Lit: for the administration of the fullness of the times, to bring together the all things in Christ, the things in the heavens and the things upon the earth,

KJV: That in the dispensation of the fulness of times he might gather together in one all things in Christ, both which are in heaven, and which are on earth; even in him:
References

"in the"
Isa 2:2-4: It will come to pass in the last days: that the mountain of the LORD's house will be established in the top of the mountains: and will be exalted above the hills; and all nations will flow to it.
Da 2:44: In the days of these kings will the God of heaven set up a kingdom: which will never be destroyed: and the kingdom will not be left to other people: but it will break in pieces and consume all these kingdoms: and it will stand for ever.
Da 9:24-27: 70 weeks are determined upon your people and upon your holy city: to finish the transgression: and to make an end of sins: and to make reconciliation for iniquity: and to bring in everlasting righteousness: and to seal up the vision and prophecy: and to anoint the most Holy.
Am 9:11: In that day will I raise up the tabernacle of David that is fallen: and close up the breaches thereof; and I will raise up his ruins: and I will build it as in the days of old:
Mic 4:1: 2: But in the last days it will come to pass: that the mountain of the house of the LORD will be established in the top of the mountains: and it will be exalted above the hills; and people will flow to it.
Mal 3:1: Look: I will send my messenger: and He will prepare the way before me: and the Lord: whom you seek: will suddenly come to His temple: even the messenger of the covenant: whom you delight in: look: He will come: says the LORD of hosts.
1Co 10:11: Now all these things happened to them for ensamples: and they are written for our admonition: upon whom the ends of the world are come.
Ga 4:4: But when the fulness of the time was come: God sent forth His Son: made of a woman: made under the law:
Heb 1:2: Has in these last days spoken to us by His Son: whom He has appointed heir of all things: by whom also He made the worlds;
Heb 9:10: Which stood only in meats and drinks: and divers washings: and carnal ordinances: imposed on them until the time of reformation.
Heb 11:40: God having provided some better thing for us: that they without us not should be made perfect.
1Pe 1:20: Who truly was foreordained before the foundation of the world: but was manifest in these last times for you:

"he"
Eph 1:22: has put all things under his feet: and gave him to be the head over all things to the church:
Eph 2:15: Having abolished in his flesh the enmity: even the law of commandments contained in ordinances; for to make in himself of two one new man: so making peace;
Eph 3:15: Of whom the whole family in heaven and earth is named:
Ge 49:10: The sceptre will not depart from Judah: nor a lawgiver from between his feet: until Shiloh come; and to him will the gathering of the people be.
Mt 25:32: Before him will be gathered all nations: and he will separate them one from another: as a shepherd divides his sheep from the goats:
1Co 3:22: 23: Whether Paul: or Apollos: or Cephas: or the world: or life: or death: or things present: or things to come; all are yours;
1Co 11:3: But I would have you know: that the head of every man is Christ; and the head of the woman is the man; and the head of Christ is God.
Php 2:9: 10: For what reason God also has highly exalted Him: and given Him a name which is above every name:
Col 1:20: And: having made peace through the blood of his cross: by him to reconcile all things to himself; by him: I say: whether they be things in earth: or things in heaven.
Col 3:11: Where there is neither Greek nor Jew: circumcision nor uncircumcision: Barbarian: Scythian: bond nor free: but Christ is all: and in all.
Heb 12:22-24: But you are come to mount Sion: and to the city of the living God: the heavenly Jerusalem: and to an innumerable company of angels:

G846αὐτῷ,autō   (PPro-DM3S)
G846 αὐτός autós ow-tos from the particle (perhaps akin to the base of ἀήρ through the idea of a baffling wind) (backward); the reflexive pronoun self, used (alone or in the comparative ἑαυτοῦ) of the third person , and (with the proper personal pronoun) of the other persons:--her, it(-self), one, the other, (mine) own, said, (self-), the) same, ((him-, my-, thy- )self, (your-)selves, she, that, their(-s), them(-selves), there(-at, - by, -in, -into, -of, -on, -with), they, (these) things, this (man), those, together, very, which. G3739ᾧhō   (RelPro-DMS)
G3739 ὅς hós ho probably a primary word (or perhaps a form of the article ὁ); the relatively (sometimes demonstrative) pronoun, who, which, what, that:--one, (an-, the) other, some, that, what, which, who(-m, -se), etc. See also οὗ., 		ᾧhō whom RelPro-DMS
G2532καὶkai   (Conj)
G2532 καί kaí kahee apparently, a primary particle, having a copulative and sometimes also a cumulative force; and, also, even, so then, too, etc.; often used in connection (or composition) with other particles or small words:--and, also, both, but, even, for, if, or, so, that, then, therefore, when, yet. 		καὶkai also Conj

G2596κατὰkata   (Prep)
G2596 κατά katá kat-ah a primary particle; (prepositionally) down (in place or time), in varied relations (according to the case (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined):--about, according as (to), after, against, (when they were) X alone, among, and, X apart, (even, like) as (concerning, pertaining to touching), X aside, at, before, beyond, by, to the charge of, (charita-)bly, concerning, + covered, (dai-)ly, down, every, (+ far more) exceeding, X more excellent, for, from … to, godly, in(-asmuch, divers, every, -to, respect of), … by, after the manner of, + by any means, beyond (out of) measure, X mightily, more, X natural, of (up-)on (X part), out (of every), over against, (+ your) X own, + particularly, so, through(-oughout, -oughout every), thus, (un-)to(-gether, -ward), X uttermost, where(-by), with. In composition it retains many of these applications, and frequently denotes opposition, distribution, or intensity. 		κατὰkata according to Prep

11 In whom also we have obtained an inheritance, being predestinated according to the purpose of him who works all things after the counsel of his own will:Ephesians 1:11
Stats
Rank: #633 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 155 characters, 26 words, 127 letters, 49 vowels, 78 consonants
Translation
Greek: εν αυτω εν ω και εκληρωθημεν προορισθεντες κατα προθεσιν του τα παντα ενεργουντος κατα την βουλην του θεληματος αυτου

Lit: in Him, in whom also we have obtained an inheritance, having been predestined according to the purpose of the One all things working according to the counsel of the will of Him,

KJV: In whom also we have obtained an inheritance, being predestinated according to the purpose of him who worketh all things after the counsel of his own will:
References

"we"
Eph 1:14: Which is the ear of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession: to the praise of his glory.
Ps 37:18: The LORD knows the days of the upright: and their inheritance will be for ever.
Ac 20:32: Now: brothers: I commend you to God: and to the word of His grace: which is able to build you up: and to give you an inheritance among all them which are sanctified.
Ac 26:18: To open their eyes: and to turn them from darkness to light: and from the power of Satan to God: that they may receive forgiveness of sins: and inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me.
Ro 8:17: If children: then heirs; heirs of God: and joint-heirs with Christ; if so be that we suffer with Him: that we may be also glorified together.
Ga 3:18: For if the inheritance be of the law: it is no more of promise: but God gave it to Abraham by promise.
Col 1:12: Giving thanks to the Father: which has made us meet to be partakers of the inheritance of the saints in light:
Col 3:24: Knowing that of the Lord you will receive the reward of the inheritance: for you serve the Lord Christ.
Tit 3:7: That being justified by his grace: we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
Jas 2:5: Listen: my beloved brothers: Has not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith: and heirs of the kingdom which He has promised to them that love Him?
1Pe 1:4: To an inheritance incorruptible: and undefiled: and that fades not away: reserved in heaven for you:
1Pe 3:9: Not rendering evil for evil: or railing for railing: but contrariwise blessing; knowing that you are thereunto called: that you should inherit a blessing.

"according"
Isa 46:10: 11: Declaring the end from the beginning: and from ancient times the things that not are yet done: saying: My counsel will stand: and I will do all my pleasure:

"the counsel"
Eph 1:8: Wherein he has abounded toward us in all wisdom and prudence;
Job 12:13: With him is wisdom and strength: he has counsel and understanding.
Pr 8:14: Counsel is my: and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength.
Isa 5:19: That say: Let Him make speed: and hasten His work: that we may see it: and let the counsel of the Holy one of Israel draw nigh and come: that we may know it!
Isa 28:29: This also comes forth from the LORD of hosts: which is wonderful in counsel: and excellent in working.
Isa 40:13: 14: Who has directed the Spirit of the LORD: or being His counseller has taught Him?
Jer 23:18: For who has stood in the counsel of the LORD: and has perceived and heard His word? who has marked His word: and heard it?
Jer 32:19: Great in counsel: and mighty in work: for your eyes are open upon all the ways of the sons of men: to give every one according to his ways: and according to the fruit of his doings:
Zec 6:13: Even He will build the temple of the LORD; and He will bear the glory: and will sit and rule upon His throne; and He will be a priest upon His throne: and the counsel of peace will be between them both.
Ac 2:23: Him: being delivered by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God: you have taken: and by wicked hands have crucified and killed:
Ac 4:28: For to do whatever your hand and your counsel determined before to be done.
Ac 20:27: For I not have shunned to declare to you all the counsel of God.
Ro 11:34: For who has known the mind of the Lord? or who has been His counseller?
Heb 6:17: Wherein God: willing more abundantly to show to the heirs of promise the immutability of His counsel: confirmed it by an oath:

 εις το ειναι ημας εις επαινον της δοξης αυτου τους προηλπικοτας εν τω χριστω
StrongsGreekEnglishMorphology
G1519εἰςeis   (Prep)
G1519 εἰς eis ice a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. Often used in composition with the same general import, but only with verbs (etc.) expressing motion (literally or figuratively). 		εἰςeis for Prep
G1510εἶναιeinai   (V-PNA)
G1510 εἰμί eimí i-mee the first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist (used only when emphatic):--am, have been, X it is I, was. See also εἶ, εἴην, εἶναι, εἰσί, ἦν, ἔσομαι, ἐσμέν, ἐστέ, ἐστί, κέρδος, ἴσθι, ὦ. 		εἶναιeinai to be V-PNA
G1473ἡμᾶςhēmas   (PPro-A1P)
G1473 ἐγώ egṓ eg-o a primary pronoun of the first person I (only expressed when emphatic):--I, me. For the other cases and the plural see ἐμέ, ἐμοί, ἐμοῦ, ἡμᾶς, ἡμεῖς, ἡμῖν, ἡμῶν, etc., 		ἡμᾶςhēmas us PPro-A1P
G1519εἰςeis   (Prep)
G1519 εἰς eis ice a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. 12 That we should be to the praise of His glory, who first trusted in Christ.Ephesians 1:12
Stats
Rank: #963 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 74 characters, 14 words, 58 letters, 19 vowels, 39 consonants
Translation
Greek: εις το ειναι ημας εις επαινον της δοξης αυτου τους προηλπικοτας εν τω χριστω

Lit: for to be us to the praise of the glory of Him, the ones having first trusted in Christ,

KJV: That we should be to the praise of his glory, who first trusted in Christ.
References

"be"
Eph 1:6: 14: To the praise of the glory of his grace: wherein he has made us accepted in the beloved.
Eph 2:7: That in the ages to come He might show the exceeding riches of His grace in His kindness toward us through Christ Jesus.
Eph 3:21: To Him be glory in the church by Christ Jesus throughout all ages: world without end. Amen.
2Th 2:13: But we are bound to give thanks alway to God for you: brothers beloved of the Lord: because God has from the beginning chosen you to salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth:

"who"
Eph 1:13: In whom you also trusted: after that you heard the word of truth: the gospel of your salvation: in whom also after that you believed: you were sealed with that holy Spirit of promise:
Ps 2:12: Kiss the Son: lest He be angry: and you perish from the way: when His wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed are all they that put their trust in Him.
Ps 146:3-5: not Put your trust in princes: nor in the son of man: in whom there is no help.
Isa 11:10: In that day there will be a root of Jesse: which will stand for an ensign of the people; to it will the Gentiles seek: and his rest will be glorious.
Isa 12:2: Look: God is my salvation; I will trust: not and be afraid: for the LORD Jehovah is my strength and my song; He also is become my salvation.
Isa 32:1: 2: Look: a king will reign in righteousness: and princes will rule in judgment.
Isa 42:1-4: Look my servant: whom I uphold; my elect: in whom my soul delights; I have put my spirit upon him: he will bring forth judgment to the Gentiles.
Isa 45:23: 25: I have sworn by myself: the word is gone out of my mouth in righteousness: and will not return: That to me every knee will bow: every tongue will swear.
Jer 17:5-7: Thus says the LORD; Cursed be the man that trusts in man: and makes flesh His arm: and whose heart departs from the LORD.
Jer 23:6: In His days Judah will be saved: and Israel will dwell safely: and this is His name whereby He will be called: THE LORD OUR RIGHTEOUSNESS.
Mt 12:18-21: Look my servant: whom I have chosen; my beloved: in whom my soul is well pleased: I will put my spirit upon him: and he will show judgment to the Gentiles.
Joh 14:1: not Let your heart be troubled: you believe in God: believe also in me.
Ro 15:12: 13: Again: Isaiah says: There will be a root of Jesse: and he who will rise to reign over the Gentiles; in him will the Gentiles trust.
2Ti 1:12: For the which cause I also suffer these things: nevertheless I not am ashamed: for I know whom I have believed: and am persuaded that he is able to keep that which I have committed to him against that day.
Jas 1:18: Of his own will begot he us with the word of truth: that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures.
1Pe 1:21: Who by Him do believe in God: that raised Him up from the dead: and gave Him glory; that your faith and hope might be in God.

G4151 πνεῦμα pneûma pnyoo-mah from πνέω; a current of air, i.e. breath (blast) or a breeze; by analogy or figuratively, a spirit, i.e. (human) the rational soul, (by implication) vital principle, mental disposition, etc., or (superhuman) an angel, demon, or (divine) God, Christs spirit, the Holy Spirit:--ghost, life, spirit(-ual, -ually), mind. 13 In whom you also trusted, after that you heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation: in whom also after that you believed, you were sealed with that holy Spirit of promise,Ephesians 1:13
Stats
Rank: #168 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 179 characters, 30 words, 141 letters, 54 vowels, 87 consonants
Translation
Greek: εν ω και υμεις ακουσαντες τον λογον της αληθειας το ευαγγελιον της σωτηριας υμων εν ω και πιστευσαντες εσφραγισθητε τω πνευματι της επαγγελιας τω αγιω

Lit: in whom also you, having heard the word of truth, the gospel of the salvation of you, in whom also having believed, you were sealed with the Spirit of promise Holy,

KJV: In whom ye also trusted, after that ye heard the word of truth, the gospel of your salvation: in whom also after that ye believed, ye were sealed with that holy Spirit of promise,
References

"ye also"
Eph 2:11: 12: For what reason remember: that you being in time past Gentiles in the flesh: who are called Uncircumcision by that which is called the Circumcision in the flesh made by hands;
Col 1:21-23: you: that were sometime alienated and enemies in your mind by wicked works: yet now has he reconciled
1Pe 2:10: Which in time past were not a people: but are now the people of God: which not had obtained mercy: but now have obtained mercy.

"after that ye heard"
Eph 4:21: If so be that you have heard Him: and have been taught by Him: as the truth is in Jesus:
Joh 1:17: For the law was given by Moses: but grace and truth came by Jesus Christ.
Ro 6:17: But God be thanked: that you were the servants of sin: but you have obeyed from the heart that form of doctrine which was delivered you.
Ro 10:14-17: How then will they call on him in whom they not have believed? and how will they believe in him of whom they not have heard? and how will they hear without a preacher?
Col 1:4-6: 23: Since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus: and of the love which you have to all the saints:
1Th 2:13: For this cause also thank we God without ceasing: because: when you received the word of God which you heard of us: you received it not as the word of men: but as it is in truth: the word of God: which effectually works also in you that believe.

"the word"
Ps 119:43: not take the word of truth utterly out of my mouth; for I have hoped in your judgments.
2Co 6:7: By the word of truth: by the power of God: by the armour of righteousness on the right hand and on the left:
2Ti 2:15: Study to show yourself approved to God: a workman that needs not to be ashamed: rightly dividing the word of truth.
Jas 1:18: Of his own will begot he us with the word of truth: that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures.

"the gospel"
Mr 16:15: 16: He said to them: Go you into all the world: and preach the gospel to every creature.
Ac 13:26: Men and brothers: children of the stock of Abraham: and whoever among you fears God: to you is the word of this salvation sent.
Ro 1:16: For I not am ashamed of the gospel of Christ: for it is the power of God to salvation to every one that believes; to the Jew first: and also to the Greek.
2Ti 3:15: That from a child you have known the holy scriptures: which are able to make you wise to salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.
Tit 2:11: For the grace of God that brings salvation has appeared to all men:
Heb 2:3: How will we escape: if we neglect so great salvation; which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord: and was confirmed to us by them that heard Him;

"ye were"
Eph 4:30: not grieve the holy Spirit of God: whereby you are sealed to the day of redemption.
Joh 6:27: not Labour for the meat which perishes: but for that meat which endures to everlasting life: which the Son of man will give to you: for Him has God the Father sealed.
Ro 4:11: He received the sign of circumcision: a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had yet being uncircumcised: that he might be the father of all them that believe: though they not be circumcised; that righteousness might be imputed to them also:
2Co 1:22: Who has also sealed us: and given the ear of the Spirit in our hearts.
2Ti 2:19: Nevertheless the foundation of God stands sure: having this seal: The Lord knows them that are His. And: Let every one that names the name of Christ depart from iniquity.
Re 7:2: I saw another angel ascending from the east: having the seal of the living God: and He cried with a loud voice to the 4 angels: to whom it was given to hurt the earth and the sea:

"holy"
Joe 2:28: It will come to pass afterward: that I will pour out my spirit upon all flesh; and your sons and your daughters will prophesy: your old men will dream dreams: your young men will see visions:
Lu 11:13: If you then: being evil: know how to give good gifts to your children: how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to them that ask Him?
Lu 24:49: And: look: I send the promise of my Father upon you: but tarry you in the city of Jerusalem: until you be endued with power from on high.
Joh 14:16: 17: 26: I will pray the Father: and He will give you another Comforter: that He may abide with you for ever;
Joh 15:26: But when the Comforter is come: whom I will send to you from the Father: even the Spirit of truth: which proceeds from the Father: He will testify of me:
Joh 16:7-15: Nevertheless I tell you the truth; It is expedient for you that I go away: for if I not go away: the Comforter not will come to you; but if I depart: I will send him to you.
Ac 1:4: And: being assembled together with them: commanded them that they not should depart from Jerusalem: but wait for the promise of the Father: which: says He: you have heard of me.
Ac 2:16-22: 33: But this is that which was spoken by the prophet Joel;
Ga 3:14: That the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Jesus Christ; that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.

14 Which is the ear of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession, to the praise of his glory.Ephesians 1:14
Stats
Counts: 119 characters, 19 words, 98 letters, 39 vowels, 59 consonants
Translation
Greek: ος εστιν αρραβων της κληρονομιας ημων εις απολυτρωσιν της περιποιησεως εις επαινον της δοξης αυτου

Lit: who is the guarantee of the inheritance of us, to the redemption of the acquired possession, to the praise of the glory of Him.

KJV: Which is the earnest of our inheritance until the redemption of the purchased possession, unto the praise of his glory.
References

"the earnest"
Ro 8:15-17: 23: For you not have received the spirit of bondage again to fear; but you have received the Spirit of adoption: whereby we cry: Abba: Father.
2Co 1:22: Who has also sealed us: and given the ear of the Spirit in our hearts.
2Co 5:5: Now He that'>He who has wrought us for the selfsame thing is God: who also has given to us the ear of the Spirit.
Ga 4:6: Because you are sons: God has sent forth the Spirit of His Son into your hearts: crying: Abba: Father.

"the redemption"
Eph 4:30: not grieve the holy Spirit of God: whereby you are sealed to the day of redemption.
Le 25:24-34: In all the land of your possession you will grant a redemption for the land.
Ps 74:2: Remember your congregation: which you have purchased of old; the rod of your inheritance: which you have redeemed; this mount Zion: wherein you have dwelt.
Ps 78:54: He brought them to the border of his sanctuary: even to this mountain: which his right hand had purchased.
Jer 32:7: 8: Look: Hanameel the son of Shallum your uncle will come to you: saying: Buy you my field that is in Anathoth: for the right of redemption is your to buy it.
Lu 21:28: When these things begin to come to pass: then look up: and lift up your heads; for your redemption draws nigh.
Ac 20:28: Take heed therefore to yourselves: and to all the flock: over the which the Holy Ghost has made you overseers: to feed the church of God: which He has purchased with His own blood.
Ro 8:23: not And only they: but ourselves also: which have the firstfruits of the Spirit: even we ourselves groan within ourselves: waiting for the adoption: to wit: the redemption of our body.
1Pe 2:9: But you are a chosen generation: a royal priesthood: an holy nation: a peculiar people; that you should show forth the praises of him who has called you out of darkness into his marvellous light:

"into"
Eph 1:6: 12: To the praise of the glory of his grace: wherein he has made us accepted in the beloved.

G1519εἰςeis   (Prep)
G1519 εἰς eis ice a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. Often used in composition with the same general import, but only with verbs (etc.) expressing motion (literally or figuratively). 		εἰςeis toward Prep
G3956πάνταςpantas   (Adj-AMP)
G3956 πᾶς pâs pas including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole:--all (manner of, means), alway(-s), any (one), X daily, + ever, every (one, way), as many as, + no(-thing), X thoroughly, whatsoever, whole, whosoever. 		πάνταςpantas all Adj-AMP

15 For what reason I also, after I heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus, and love to all the saints,Ephesians 1:15
Stats
Rank: #1693 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 94 characters, 17 words, 73 letters, 31 vowels, 42 consonants
Translation
Greek: δια τουτο καγω ακουσας την καθ υμας πιστιν εν τω κυριω ιησου και την αγαπην την εις παντας τους αγιους

Lit: Because of this I also, having heard of the among you faith in the Lord Jesus and the love toward all the saints,

KJV: Wherefore I also, after I heard of your faith in the Lord Jesus, and love unto all the saints,
References

"after"
Col 1:3: 4: We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ: praying always for you:
Phm 1:5: Hearing of your love and faith: which you have toward the Lord Jesus: and toward all saints;

"faith"
Ga 5:6: For in Jesus Christ neither circumcision availeth any thing: nor uncircumcision; but faith which works by love.
1Th 1:3: Remembering without ceasing your work of faith: and labour of love: and patience of hope in our Lord Jesus Christ: in the sight of God and our Father;
2Th 1:3: We are bound to thank God always for you: brothers: as it is meet: because that your faith grows exceedingly: and the charity of every one of you all toward each other abounds;
1Ti 1:5: 14: Now the end of the commandment is charity out of a pure heart: and of a good conscience: and of faith unfeigned:

"love"
Ps 16:3: But to the saints that are in the earth: and to the excellent: in whom is all my delight.
Col 1:4: Since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus: and of the love which you have to all the saints:
1Th 4:9: But as touching brotherly love you not need that I write to you: for you yourselves are taught of God to love one another.
Heb 6:10: For God is not unrighteous to forget your work and labour of love: which you have showed toward His name: in that you have ministered to the saints: and do minister.
1Pe 1:22: Seeing you have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit to unfeigned love of the brothers: see that you love one another with a pure heart fervently:
1Jo 3:17: But whoever has this world's good: and sees His brother have need: and shuts up His bowels of compassion from Him: how dwells the love of God in Him?
1Jo 4:21: This commandment have we from Him: That He who loves God love His brother also.

G1909ἐπὶepi   (Prep)
G1909 ἐπί epí ep-ee a primary preposition; properly, meaning superimposition (of time, place, order, etc.), as a relation of distribution (with the genitive case), i.e. over, upon, etc.; of rest (with the dative case) at, on, etc.; of direction (with the accusative case) towards, upon, etc.:--about (the times), above, after, against, among, as long as (touching), at, beside, X have charge of, (be-, (where-))fore, in (a place, as much as, the time of, -to), (because) of, (up-)on (behalf of), over, (by, for) the space of, through(-out), (un-)to(-ward), with. KJV: Cease not to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers;
References

"Cease"

1Sa 7:8: The children of Israel said to Samuel: not Cease to cry to the LORD our God for us: that He will save us out of the hand of the Philistines.

1Th 1:2: We give thanks to God always for you all: making mention of you in our prayers;
